title: Accessibility issues
text: Tags define structure PDF screen readers can understand . avoid : Always tag document exporting . Use headings, paragraphs, list styles Word InDesign export tool generates proper tags automatically.

title: Accessibility issues
text: screen reader follows tag order, visual layout. avoid : Check reading order PDF editor make sure logical flow matches document meant read.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Without title, screen reader browser may show file name. avoid : Set document title PDF properties “Description” exporting authoring tool.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Screen readers can’t describe images unless alt text provided. avoid : Add meaningful alternative text image conveys purpose, mark decorative images artifacts.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Tables need headers structure navigation. avoid : Use table headers ensure merged cells tagged correctly. Avoid using tables layout.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Skipping Heading 1 Heading 4 breaks logical hierarchy. avoid : Follow consistent heading structure (H1 → H2 → H3) users can navigate section.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Text blends background unreadable users low vision. avoid : Maintain contrast ratio least 4.5:1 body text 3:1 large text, per WCAG standards.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Scanned pages often just pictures text can’t read assistive tech. avoid : Use OCR (Optical Character Recognition) convert scanned text selectable, searchable text.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Assistive tools need know document’s language pronounce words correctly. avoid : Set document’s primary language PDF’s metadata.

title: Accessibility issues
text: Without bookmarks, navigation becomes difficult. avoid : Add bookmarks main sections headings longer PDFs.

text: PDF accessibility ensures everyone, including people disabilities, can access understand content PDF. goes beyond simply making document readable screen. requires structuring content assistive technologies, screen readers, magnifiers, voice navigation tools, can interpret accurately. properly tagged PDF includes logical headings, lists, tables, links reflect real structure document. Images charts alternative text describes purpose meaning. Text embedded images, users can select, search, copy . example, scanned document turned searchable text using OCR (Optical Character Recognition) accessible flat image. also conformance levels defined standards like PDF/UA-1 (ISO 14289-1), focuses universal accessibility, PDF/, ensures long-term preservation content. Within PDF/, levels (Accessible), B (Basic), U (Unicode) define well document preserves structure text accessibility. PDF/-1a PDF/-2a, instance, include tagged structure language specification meet accessibility goals, PDF/-1b guarantees visual reproducibility.

title: Check PDF accessibility
text: Make sure install verapdf*: *necessary already verapdf cli PATH  Check PDF PDF/UA-1 compliant: works many standards: profile can ua1, ua2, 1a, 1b, 2a, 2b, 2u, 3a, 3b, 3u, 4, 4f, 4e. Default ua1. can find meaning .  Generate HTML accessibility report:  Print accessibility summary
code: checkpdf::install_verapdf() checkpdf::is_pdf_compliant("report.pdf") #> TRUE  # check for PDF/UA-2 checkpdf::is_pdf_compliant("report.pdf", profile = "ua2") #> FALSE # Basic usage: this opens your browser checkpdf::accessibility_report("report.pdf")  # Explicit output file checkpdf::accessibility_report(    "report.pdf",    output_file = "report.html" )  # Do not open browser checkpdf::accessibility_report(    "report.pdf",    output_file = "report.html",    open = FALSE )  # Specify a different accessibility standard checkpdf::accessibility_report(    "report.pdf",    output_file = "report.html",    open = FALSE,    profile = "ua2" ) checkpdf::accessibility_summary("report.pdf") #> PDF Accessibility Summary #> ========================= #> Verapdf version:  1.28.2 #> Compliant:  No #> Profile:  ua1 #> #> Passed Rules:   95 #> Passed Checks:  591 #> Failed Rules:   11 #> Failed Checks:  195
